author: Nostalgia Nerd
description:
90s PCs really did have a fish inside them; a virtual pet called Mopyfish, created by HP in 1996. It wasn’t just a cute desktop companion; it was a marketing tool designed to make you print more documents. Every time you used an HP Mopier to print multiple originals, you earned “Mopy points” to buy plants, bubbles and upgrades for your fish.

By the year 2000, Mopyfish had been downloaded over ten million times, becoming the world’s most popular cyberpet; all because HP wanted to sell more toner.

If you remember this little orange fish swimming across your Windows desktop, you were part of one of the 90s’ strangest marketing campaigns.

#retro #90scomputing #windows98 #mopyfish #nostalgianerd
title: Some 90s PCs Contained a Fish
